newsitem.title: MALAYSIA: Malaysia rubber closes the week lower.
newsitem.headline: Malaysia rubber closes the week lower.

text.p: Malaysian rubber prices ended the week lower on technical adjustment and losses in Tokyo, but dealers expect a rebound next week on expectation of thin supply and fresh demand.
"Prices were easing because of technical correction and falls in Tokyo," a dealer at a trading firm said, adding that lack of strong demand also limited activity.
But dealers expect demand to pick next week as European dealers return from summer holidays.
"Factories are resuming their operations and they need the raw materials, so they have to start buying now for forward shipment," another dealer said.
Tight supplies, because of the wet weather, also cautioned producers from selling in large volume, dealers said.
At the close, the Malaysian Rubber Exchange and Licensing Board set market indicator price for October RSS1 buyer at 329 cents ($1.32) a kg and October SMR 20 buyer at 315.50 cents.
